description.narrative:
Unnayan Unneshan (UO) is a technical partner organization of Oxfam Novib food security and resilience program. The organization worked as think tank and provided technical support to implementing partners of former RESOLVE program from 2011-June 2013. UO conducted research work, prepared knowledge documents for the implementing partners and assessment on livelihood improvement of program participants. Oxfam Novib#s future priority will be on support to small and marginal farmers with market based production intervention for improving food security and livelihood. The assessment will help to identify opportunities, design and implement of market based intervention in future. The assessment conducts in existing livelihoods program areas in 3 districts such as Gaibandha, Sirajgonj and Shariatpur.
The objective of the assessment is to suggest mechanisms for enhancing the scale of production through formation of Smallholding Producers# groups. It includes, a comparative assessment of existing arrangements of farmers# groups and their efficacy in accessing market, development of three alternative models and scenarios for each intervention areas, conducting focus group discussions with RHs and relevant groups to identify the most appropriate model for the particular locality and finalisation of preferredmodel for scaling up production.

participating-org.narrative: The Unnayan Onneshan-The Innovators, a centre for research and action on development, is an independent non-profit registered Trust, which aims to contribute to innovation in development through research, advocacy, solidarity and action. The centre was established in August 2003 (and registered) by a group of university faculties and development professionals across Bangladesh to contribute to the search for solutions to endemic poverty, injustice, gender inequality an environmental degradation at the local, national and global levels. The Trust is known as Unnayan Onneshan in Bangla and again it was registered in 2008 (Registration No.5859-iv-23, Date 12.06.2008). The internal professional staff and external fellows are grouped into three research based and two function based operational units – Economic Policy, Social Policy, Climate Change, Biodiversity and DRR, Perspective Building and Policy Literacy Unit, and HR, Admin and Finance. The Unnayan Onneshan is a Progressive think- tank that undertakes research for advancing ideas and building constituencies for social transformation. The public- interest research institute works in collaboration with national partners, international organizations and leading universities.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: no. of women and men (small-scale crop farmers, cattle farmers, fisher folk) able to use sustainable production methods enabling them to better protect and use sustainably their livelihood resources
